intro: Cyphostemma degraeri, commonly known as the Natal star vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces orange-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding visual interest to gardens. Cyphostemma degraeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial shade.
